source_sentence: 佛說大堅固婆羅門緣起經卷上
translation: Foshuo dajianguo bolomen fenqi jing shoushang

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝奉大夫試光祿卿
translation: Minister of Light for the Tripiṭaka Translation of the Sutra of the Western Paradise, the Grand Master of the Chaofeng

source_sentence: 傳法大師賜紫臣施護等奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by imperial order from the purple ministers, Shihou and others, given by the great Dharma transmitter

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時，世尊在王舍城鷲峯山中，與大眾俱。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Bhagavān was in Vulture Peak in Rājagṛha with a large group of people.

source_sentence: 是時，有五髻乾闥婆王子，過於夜分，至明旦時，來詣佛所——彼有身光廣大照耀，彼鷲峯山都一光聚——到佛所已，頭面禮足，退住一面，前白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At the time, a five-tufted Qianzhong prince who had passed through the night and arrived at sunrise and visited the Buddha-who had a body whose light shone so brightly that Vulture Peak was a cluster of lights-arrived at the Buddha, bowed his head and feet, withdrew to one side, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於一時，在三十三天，見帝釋天主、大梵天王并善法天眾而共集會有所宣說——我親所聞，我親所受——是義云何？
translation: At one point, I was in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven and saw Lord Indra, King Brahmā, and a multitude of good Dharma gods assemble together and proclaim something that I had personally heard and that I had personally received-what does that mean?

source_sentence: 唯願世尊！
translation: Venerable Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 告示於我，令我了知。」
translation: Tell me about it so that I'll understand it."

source_sentence: 佛告五髻乾闥婆王子言：「所有汝於三十三天帝釋天主、大梵天王并善法天眾共集會處有所聽受，我今如應告語於汝，令汝了知。」
translation: The Buddha addressed the five-knitted prince Qianzang, "Now, I will tell you what you've heard from the Trāyastriṃśa gods, the king of Brahmā, and the assembly of the good Dharma gods, as it should be, so that you will understand it."

source_sentence: 時，五髻乾闥婆王子，復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Then, the five-knotted prince Ganondorf again said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於一時在三十三天帝釋天主、大梵天王并善法天眾共集會處。
translation: At one point, I was in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven where Lord Indra, King Brahmā, and a multitude of good Dharma gods had gathered.

source_sentence: 是時，或有天子，以因緣故，初生彼天。
translation: At the time, some gods' sons were first born in those heavens because of a cause.

source_sentence: 同時，有餘先生天子，見初生者，乃起五種極愛樂事，所謂壽命、色相、名稱、吉祥、眷屬等。
translation: At the same time, there are other gods whose sons see that first birth and become extremely fond of five things, which are longevity, appearance, name, good fortune, and dependents.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼有一類天子，作如是言：『諸天子！
translation: One group of celestials said, 'Children of the gods!

source_sentence: 汝等且觀，此初生天子，有餘先生天子，起於五種極愛樂事，所謂壽命、色相、名稱、吉祥、眷屬等。』
translation: You see, this first-born god, and there are other gods who are extremely fond of five things, which are longevity, appearance, name, good fortune, and dependents.'

source_sentence: 彼時，又有一類天子，作如是言：『諸天子！
translation: At the time, there was another type of gods who said, 'Children of gods!

source_sentence: 此初生者是佛世尊聲聞法中，修梵行已，身壞命終，感善趣報，而來生此三十三天。
translation: This first birth was in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven after the Bhagavān cultivated the religious practice, his body broke up, and his life ended, and he was rewarded with a good destiny.

source_sentence: 同時，有諸先生天子，乃起五種極愛樂事。』
translation: At the same time, there are gentlemen celestials who take on five kinds of extreme delight in this world.'

source_sentence: 彼時又有一類天子，作如是言：『快哉諸天子！
translation: At the time, there was another type of gods who said, 'It's wonderful, you gods!

source_sentence: 有四佛如來、應供、正等正覺，出現世間，宣說諸法，利益天人，損減阿脩羅眾，增益天眾。』
translation: There are four Tathāgatas, Arhats, and Fully Awakened Ones who appear in the world, expound the teachings, benefit gods and humans, diminish the multitude of asuras, and increase the multitude of gods.'

source_sentence: 彼時，又有一類天子，作如是言：『止！
translation: At the time, there was another type of celestial who said, 'Stop!

source_sentence: 諸天子！
translation: all the sons of gods!

source_sentence: 非四佛如來、應供、正等正覺，出現世間。
translation: It's not the four buddha-tathāgatas, worshipful offerings, and correct enlightenment that appear in the world.

source_sentence: 快哉！
translation: How wonderful!

source_sentence: 諸天子！
translation: all the sons of gods!

source_sentence: 有三佛如來、應供、正等正覺，出現世間，宣說諸法，利益天人，損減阿脩羅眾，增益天眾。』
translation: There are three buddha-tathāgatas, worshipful offerings, and correct enlightenment who appear in the world, expound the Dharma, benefit gods and humans, diminish the multitude of asuras, and increase the multitude of gods.'

source_sentence: 彼時，又有一類天子，作如是言：『止！
translation: At the time, there was another type of celestial who said, 'Stop!

source_sentence: 諸天子！
translation: all the sons of gods!

source_sentence: 非三佛如來、應供、正等正覺，出現世間。
translation: Not the three buddha-tathāgatas, worshipful offerings, and correct and perfectly enlightened people who appear in the world.

source_sentence: 快哉！
translation: How wonderful!

source_sentence: 諸天子！
translation: all the sons of gods!

source_sentence: 有二佛如來、應供、正等正覺，出現世間，宣說諸法，利益天人，損減阿修羅眾，增益天眾。』
translation: There are two buddhas, the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, and the Completely Awakened One, who appear in the world and expound the Dharma for the benefit of gods and humans, to diminish the multitude of asuras, and to increase the multitude of gods.'

source_sentence: 如是等事，願佛為說。」
translation: Such are the things that I wish the Buddha would explain for me."

source_sentence: 是時，帝釋天主、大梵天王在佛會中，佛以是事告帝釋天主并天眾言：「汝等當知，同一時中，無處容受二佛如來、應供、正等正覺，出現世間，宣說諸法。」
translation: It was then that the lord of Indra and the king of the Brahma gods were present in the Buddha's assembly, and the Buddha addressed the lord of Indra and the gods about this matter, saying, "You should know that there's nowhere at the same time that two Tathāgatas, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened, appear in the world and proclaim the Dharma."

source_sentence: 時，帝釋天主并諸天眾，聞佛語已，咸生歡喜，心意快然。
translation: When the lord Indra and the celestials heard what the Buddha said, they all rejoiced and were pleased with themselves.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊知彼帝釋天主并諸天眾咸生歡喜，即告眾言：「如來、應供、正等正覺出現世間，具足八種希有之法。
translation: Knowing that the Śakra Devānām-Indra and the multitude of gods were rejoicing, the Bhagavān addressed the crowd, "The Tathāgata, the Worthy Offerer, and the Perfectly Enlightened One has appeared in the world and is fully equipped with eight rare teachings.

source_sentence: 汝等若欲聞者，應當勝前發歡喜心起忻樂意。」
translation: If you want to hear them, you should rejoice and be delighted."

source_sentence: 即時，佛告帝釋天主言：「憍尸迦！
translation: At that moment, the Buddha addressed the lord of Indra, saying, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 汝今為此天眾，隨應樂說如來、應供、正等正覺八希有法。」
translation: Now, for this multitude of gods, you should delight in explaining the eight rare dharmas of the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One."

source_sentence: 時，帝釋天主承佛教勅，宣說世尊八希有法：「諸天子！
translation: At the time, Lord Indra was commanded by the Buddha to preach the eight rare teachings of the Bhagavān: "Children of the gods!

source_sentence: 隨有如來、應供、正等正覺出現世間，決定損減阿脩羅眾，增益天眾，能令多人利益安樂。
translation: Whenever the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One appear in the world, they're certain to diminish the multitude of asuras and increase the multitude of gods, which can bring benefit and happiness to many people.

source_sentence: 如是利樂，是為希有。
translation: Such benefit and happiness are rare.

source_sentence: 「復次，諸天子！
translation: "Furthermore, my fellow gods!

source_sentence: 如來大師出現世間，我不見於過去及今現在而有別異，是故如來、應供、正等正覺出現世間，宣說法教，利益天人。
translation: "When the Tathāgata and the Great Teacher appeared in the world, I didn't see any difference between the past and present, so the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened One appeared in the world, taught the Dharma, and benefited gods and humans.

source_sentence: 所謂破諸見法、離染污法、順觀法、潔白法、了知諸受法、除憍慢法、調伏渴流法、破無明法、斷依止法、離貪愛法、寂滅法、涅槃法。
translation: These are the teaching that refutes views, parts with defilements, observes things favorably, cleanses things, understands feelings, removes conceit, tames thirst, refutes ignorance, ends attachments, parts with cravings, becomes tranquil, and attains nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 如是宣說諸法，是為希有。
translation: Such an explanation of the various dharmas is rare.

source_sentence: 「復次，諸天子！
translation: "Furthermore, my fellow gods!

source_sentence: 如來大師出現世間，我不見於過去及今現在而有別異，是故如來、應供、正等正覺出現世間，為諸聲聞教示學法，謂所應修諸無瞋法。
translation: When the Tathāgata and the Great Teacher appeared in the world, I didn't see any difference between the past and the present; therefore, the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened One appeared in the world and taught śrāvakas the way to train, which is to cultivate the dharma of no anger.

source_sentence: 以此緣故，如來、應供、正等正覺重重教示：『諸修行者，應於曠野寂靜等處修無諍行，若行、若住、若坐、若臥，遠離憒閙，及離諠繁，隨自依止、隨自色相、隨自忻樂、隨自所愛，勿雜他人，隨自應行。』
translation: For this reason, the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened One repeatedly instructed, 'Practitioners should cultivate noncontentious behavior in quiet places in the wilderness, such as walking, standing, sitting, and lying down, secluded from hustle and bustle, following their own support, their own appearance, their own pleasure, and their own desires, not mixed with others, and following their own actions.'

source_sentence: 如是教示，是為希有。
translation: Such an instruction is rare.

source_sentence: 「復次，諸天子！
translation: "Furthermore, my fellow gods!

source_sentence: 如來大師出現世間，我不見於過去及今現在而有別異，是故如來、應供、正等正覺出現世間，雖復隨順受諸飲食，如來常得食中上味，及得正味，得第一味，得不離散味。
translation: When the Tathāgata and the Great Teacher appeared in the world, I didn't see any difference between the past and present, so even though the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Fully Awakened One appeared in the world and followed the foods and drinks that he received, the Tathāgata always attained the highest of flavors in his diet, attained the right taste, attained the first taste, and attained a taste that wasn't distracting.

source_sentence: 又復，如來、應供、正等正覺所受飲食，遠離憍慢無住無著，常離過失起正智慧，常欲出離。
translation: Furthermore, when the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened One receive food and drink, they are free of conceit, without abiding or attachment, always free of faults and errors, and they arouse right wisdom and always want to escape.

source_sentence: 復以此法教示一切，是為希有。
translation: Again, this is a rare way to teach and show them all.

source_sentence: 「復次，諸天子！
translation: "Furthermore, my fellow gods!

source_sentence: 如來大師出現世間，我不見於過去及今現在而有別異，是故如來、應供、正等正覺出現世間，具足神通，為諸聲聞說神通法，教示開導使令修行。
translation: "When the Tathāgata and the Great Teacher appeared in the world, I didn't see any difference between the past and present, so the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One appeared in the world, fully endowed with supernormal powers, taught the śrāvakas the supernormal Dharma, and instructed and guided them to cultivate it.

source_sentence: 如是教示，是為希有。
translation: Such an instruction is rare.

source_sentence: 「復次，諸天子！
translation: "Furthermore, children of gods!

source_sentence: 如來大師出現世間，我不見於過去及今現在而有別異，是故如來、應供、正等正覺出現世間，離諸疑惑，亦離疑論，於善法中得無所畏，如是離疑者，是為希有。
translation: When the Tathāgata and the Great Teacher appear in the world, I don't see any difference between the past and the present; therefore, when the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened One appears in the world, he's free of uncertainty and doubtful arguments, and he attains fearlessness in the midst of good qualities; such a person who's free of doubt is rare.

source_sentence: 「復次，諸天子！
translation: "Furthermore, my fellow gods!

source_sentence: 如來大師出現世間，我不見於過去及今現在而有別異，是故如來、應供、正等正覺，出現世間，於諸法中如說能行，如行能說，復以諸法，教示開導使令修行。
translation: "When the Tathāgata and the Great Teacher appear in the world, I don't see any distinctions between the past and present, so the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened One appears in the world, teaching and practicing as he teaches and explaining as he practices, and teaching and guiding the cultivation of those teachings.

source_sentence: 如是教示，是為希有。
translation: Such an instruction is rare.

source_sentence: 「復次，諸天子！
translation: "Furthermore, children of gods!

source_sentence: 如來大師出現世間，我不見於過去及今現在而有別異，是故如來、應供、正等正覺，出現世間，教示涅槃及涅槃道，增長充滿無有窮盡。
translation: "When the Tathāgata and the Great Teacher appear in the world, I don't see any distinction between the past and present, so the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Fully Awakened One appears in the world, teaches and demonstrates nirvāṇa and the path to nirvāṇa, and fills it up without limit.

source_sentence: 譬如殑伽河水閻牟那河水流注大海增長無盡，如來、應供、正等正覺亦復如是，教示涅槃及涅槃道，善巧宣說諸涅槃法，及善安立，使令修行增長無盡。
translation: Just as the Gaṅgā River and the Yamunā River flow into the ocean and grow endlessly, so too does the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened One teach and show nirvāṇa and the path to nirvāṇa, skillfully expound the teachings of nirvāṇa, and skillfully establish them so that their cultivation grows endlessly.

source_sentence: 如是教示者，是為希有。
translation: Such a teaching and instruction is rare.

source_sentence: 「諸天子！
translation: "My lords!

source_sentence: 如來大師出現世間，具足如是八種希有之法，是故我不見於過去及今現在而有別異。」
translation: The Tathāgata great teacher appeared in the world and possessed these eight rare qualities; therefore, I don't see any difference between the past and the present."

source_sentence: 是時，彼天子眾聞是說已，又復勝前，咸生歡喜，心意快然，俱白帝釋天主言：「天主！
translation: When the multitude of celestials who heard this, they were again superior, rejoiced, and had happy thoughts, and they all said to Śakra Devānām-Indra, "Śakra!

source_sentence: 願為我等重復宣說彼如來、應供、正等正覺八種希有之法。」
translation: May you again explain for us the eight rare dharmas of the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, and the Perfectly Enlightened One."

source_sentence: 時，帝釋天主為彼天眾，第二宣說如來八希有法：「復次，諸天子！
translation: Lord Indra then secondly explained the eight rare dharmas of the Tathāgata to that multitude of gods, "Furthermore, children of gods!

source_sentence: 隨有如來、應供、正等正覺出現世間，決定損減阿脩羅眾，增益天眾，能令多人利益安樂，如是利樂，是為希有。
translation: Whenever the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One appear in the world, they're certain to diminish the multitude of asuras and increase the multitude of gods, which can bring benefit and happiness to many people, and such benefit and happiness is rare.

source_sentence: 諸天子！
translation: Children of the gods!

source_sentence: 是故如來大師出現世間，我不見於過去及今現在而有別異，如是如前廣說，乃至如來、應供、正等正覺，出現世間，教示涅槃及涅槃道，增長充滿無有窮盡。
translation: Therefore, when the Tathāgata great teacher appears in the world, I don't see any distinction between the past and present, as was explained in detail earlier, even when the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened One appears in the world, teaches and demonstrates nirvāṇa and the path to nirvāṇa, and increases and fills it without limit.

source_sentence: 譬如殑伽河水、閻牟那河水流注大海增長無盡，如來、應供、正等正覺亦復如是，教示涅槃及涅槃道，善巧宣說諸涅槃法，及善安立，使令修行增長無盡。
translation: Just as the Gaṅgā River and the Yamunā River flow into the ocean and grow endlessly, so too does the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened One teach and show nirvāṇa and the path to nirvāṇa, skillfully expound the teachings of nirvāṇa, and skillfully establish them so that their cultivation grows endlessly.

source_sentence: 如是教示，是為希有。
translation: Such a teaching and instruction is rare.

source_sentence: 諸天子！
translation: My fellow gods!

source_sentence: 如來大師出現世間，具足如是八希有法。
translation: The Tathāgata great teacher appeared in the world and was fully endowed with these eight rare qualities.

source_sentence: 是故我不見於過去及今現在而有別異。」
translation: I therefore don't see any distinctions between the past and present."

source_sentence: 如是言已，彼天子眾又復勝前，咸生歡喜，心意快然。
translation: After saying this, the crowd of celestials was again superior to the previous crowd, and they all rejoiced and were pleased with themselves.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊知天子眾又復勝前生歡喜已，復告帝釋天主言：「憍尸迦！
translation: Knowing that the multitude of celestials was again superior to the previous ones and rejoicing, the Bhagavān then addressed Śakra Devānām-Indra, saying, "Kauśika!

source_sentence: 汝今重復宣說如來、應供、正等正覺八希有法。」
translation: Now, you will again explain the eight rare dharmas of the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One."

source_sentence: 是時帝釋天主承佛教勅，第三復說八希有法：「復次，諸天子！
translation: At that point, Lord Indra was commanded by the Buddha to repeat the teaching of the eight rare dharmas: "Furthermore, my fellow gods!

source_sentence: 隨有如來、應供、正等正覺，出現世間，決定損減阿脩羅眾，增益天眾，能令多人利益安樂。
translation: Whenever the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One appear in the world, they're sure to diminish the multitude of asuras and increase the multitude of gods, which can bring benefit and happiness to many people.

source_sentence: 如是利樂，是為希有。
translation: Such benefit and happiness are rare.

source_sentence: 諸天子！
translation: Children of the gods!

source_sentence: 是故如來大師出現世間，我不見於過去及今現在而有別異，如是如前廣說，乃至如來、應供、正等正覺，出現世間，教示涅槃及涅槃道，增長充滿無有窮盡。
translation: Therefore, when the Tathāgata great teacher appears in the world, I don't see any distinction between the past and present, as was explained in detail earlier, even when the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened One appears in the world, teaches and demonstrates nirvāṇa and the path to nirvāṇa, and increases and fills it without limit.

source_sentence: 譬如殑伽河水、閻牟那河水流注大海增長無盡，如來、應供、正等正覺亦復如是，教示涅槃及涅槃道，善巧宣說諸涅槃法，及善安立，使令修行增長無盡。
translation: Just as the Gaṅgā River and the Yamunā River flow into the ocean and grow endlessly, so too does the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened One teach and show nirvāṇa and the path to nirvāṇa, skillfully expound the teachings of nirvāṇa, and skillfully establish them so that their cultivation grows endlessly.

source_sentence: 如是教示，是為希有。
translation: Such a teaching and instruction is rare.

source_sentence: 諸天子！
translation: My fellow gods!

source_sentence: 如來大師出現世間，具足如是八希有法，是故我不見於過去及今現在而有別異。」
translation: The Tathāgata great teacher appeared in the world and was fully endowed with these eight rare qualities; therefore, I don't see any difference between the past and the present."

source_sentence: 如是言已。
translation: After he said that, the king of Brahmā knew that his celestials were again superior to his predecessors.

source_sentence: 時，大梵天王知彼天眾又復勝前，咸生歡喜心意快然，即說伽陀曰：「帝釋天主并天眾，　　咸生如是歡喜心，　歸命稱讚佛如來，　　善說如來希有法。
translation: Knowing that the multitude of gods was again superior to the previous one, the king of the Brahmas rejoiced and was pleased, so he said to Gadha, "Thus rejoicing, the lord of Indra and the multitude of gods all give their orders to the Tathāgata and praise him for well explaining the rare qualities of the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 昔見天中初生者，　　具足色相及威光，　由於梵行久已修，　　得生彼天具勝力。」
translation: I once saw a firstborn among the gods who was fully proportioned in appearance and radiance and who, because of his long-standing cultivation of the religious practice, was born in that heaven with surpassing powers."

source_sentence: 時，三十三天眾聞是伽陀已，又復勝前，咸生歡喜，心意快然。
translation: When the Trāyastriṃśa gods heard this Gṛdhrakūṭa, they were again superior to the previous one, rejoiced, and were pleased with themselves.

source_sentence: 爾時，大梵天王知彼天眾又復勝前生歡喜已，即告眾言：「汝等若欲樂聞，如來、應供、正等正覺，具大智慧，於長夜中多所利樂，如是事者，應當勝前發歡喜心，起忻樂意。」
translation: Knowing that the multitude of those gods was again more than happy, the king of the Brahmas then addressed the crowd, "If you want to be delighted to hear that the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One has great wisdom and is full of benefit during the long night and such things, you should be more than happy and arouse gladness."

source_sentence: 時，彼天眾俱白大梵天王言：「善哉！
translation: The multitude of gods then said to the king of the Brahmā gods, "Good!

source_sentence: 大梵天王，唯願廣說，如來、應供、正等正覺具大智慧，於長夜中利樂等事。」
translation: Please explain in detail, King Brahmadeva, how the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One possess great wisdom and do things like bring benefit and joy during long nights."

source_sentence: 時，大梵天王即為廣說如來大智往昔因緣。
translation: The king of the Brahmas then explained in detail the causes and conditions of the Tathāgata's great wisdom from the past.

source_sentence: 時，梵王言：「世尊！
translation: The king of Brahmā then said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 乃往過去世中，有一國王，其名域主。
translation: Once upon a time in a past life, there was a king whose name was Lord of the Realm.

source_sentence: 彼時有一婆羅門，名曰堅固，居輔相位，為王之師，聰明大智，具大才略，善治國事。
translation: At the time, there was a Brāhmaṇa named Gṛdhrakūṭa who served as the king's advisor, was intelligent and had great wisdom, possessed great abilities, and was skilled in the management of the king's affairs.

source_sentence: 王有太子，名曰黎努，王所愛念，聰明大智，復有大才，善了眾事。
translation: The king had a prince named Rinnu, whom the king loved and respected, who was intelligent, had great wisdom, and had great skills, and who well understood various matters.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼黎努太子，別有六人剎帝利童子，而為伴友，常所共會，聚砂為戲。
translation: That prince Rānu had six other children from Śādrika who were his companions, always met together, and gathered sand for play.

source_sentence: 彼輔相堅固婆羅門，亦有一子，名曰護明，深所愛念，才智聰利，凡所歷事，無不洞明。
translation: That auxiliary firm Brāhmaṇa also has a son named Huoming, who is deeply loved, intelligent, and insightful, and who knows everything that comes his way.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 而彼輔相參治政事，頗經時歲，其後一時忽趣命終。
translation: That auxiliary minister had been involved in government affairs for quite some time and then suddenly ended up dying.

source_sentence: 王聞輔相堅固婆羅門已趣命終，愁憂懊惱悲軫淚流，撫膝驚惶，癡悶如絕，乃作是言：『我此輔相，頗有才智，參治國政，深為良佐，復常與我共所娛樂，而忽命終，我深苦惱。』
translation: When the king heard that his auxiliary minister, Gṛdhabarman, had reached the end of his life, he was overcome with sadness, distress, pity, and tears, and he threw his knees in fear and became as dumb as death.

source_sentence: 時，彼太子聞其父王為輔相堅固婆羅門已趣命終，愁憂懊惱悲軫淚流，太子即時往詣王所，到已白言：『父王勿須憂愁，勿須涕泣，何故自損癡悶如絕？
translation: When the prince heard that his father, the minister of state, was a solid brāhmaṇa who had reached the end of his life, he was overcome with grief and distress, and his tears flowed down his face.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 父王當知，堅固婆羅門有一長子，名曰護明，具有才智，又復聰利，若繼父位，能曉政事，其父所解，此子悉知，今有此人，王何憂惱！
translation: Father, you should know that the solid Brahmins have an eldest son named Hosomin who is gifted and intelligent, and who is also clever enough to succeed his father and understand government affairs, and who knows everything that his father understands.

source_sentence: 王應密召，隨事教招，以父所任當授其子。』
translation: The king then responded to the secret summons and recruited him according to his father's teaching, saying, 'I will give my son what his father has asked of him.'

source_sentence: 「時，王聞已，即命使人乃謂之曰：『汝往護明童子所傳如是言：「王今召汝，宜速來此。」』
translation: "When the king heard this, he ordered the messenger to tell him, 'Go to the Boy Hosshin and convey this message to him, 'The king summons you now; come here quickly.'

source_sentence: 使人受命，即時往詣護明童子所，既到彼已，具宣王勅：『今召於汝，宜速往彼。』
translation: The messenger did as ordered, and immediately went to the Boy Prabhūtaratna. When he arrived, he announced the king's order, 'Now that you've been summoned, it's appropriate to go there quickly.'

source_sentence: 時，護明童子聞使人言，即時來詣王所。
translation: Upon hearing the messenger's words, the Boy Vermilion immediately went to the king's residence.

source_sentence: 到已伸敬，令一面坐。
translation: When he arrived, he paid respect and was made to sit to one side.

source_sentence: 時，王歡喜重復慰諭，作如是言：『我今如實教示於汝，汝父喪逝，雖復愁惱，我今令汝繼其父位，而為輔相。
translation: The king then rejoiced and repeatedly reassured him, saying, 'Now, I've truly taught you that even though your father died and you're still sad, I'm going to allow you to succeed your father and serve as his assistant.

source_sentence: 汝善為我共治國政。』
translation: You will be a good servant to me in the administration of the country.'

source_sentence: 護明童子受王教命，即繼父位乃為輔相，共治國政如父所作，諸所應事，悉如其父，而無違失。
translation: The boy Prabhākaramitra was instructed by the king to succeed his father as vice-minister and to govern the country together as his father had done, doing all the things that were expected of him without fail.

source_sentence: 爾時，國中婆羅門長者士庶人民，知是事已，咸作是言：『快哉！
translation: Knowing this, the Brahmin elders, the common people, and the people of the country all said, 'Excellent!

source_sentence: 護明童子！
translation: Boy Protectors of the Light!

source_sentence: 汝父昔時名為堅固，子今繼位，克廣前業，我等稱汝名大堅固。』
translation: Your father was once called 'Solid,' and now that his son has succeeded to the throne and has spread his former karma, we'll call you 'Great Solid.'

source_sentence: 其本名字為護明者，以火中出因緣立號，從今已後稱大堅固。
translation: That man, whose original name was Guomin, was named after the cause and conditions that arose in the fire, and from now on he'll be called Greatly Resolute.

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 爾時，輔相大堅固婆羅門為相未久，即時往詣六人剎帝利童子所，到已謂言：『汝諸童子！
translation: At the time, the auxiliary great solid Brahmin, who hadn't been a minister for a long time, immediately went to the six Zetri boys and said, 'You boys!

source_sentence: 宜應往彼黎努太子所，告於彼言：「太子！
translation: You should go to that prince Rānu and tell him, "Crown prince!

source_sentence: 若有苦惱，汝我同受；若有快樂，汝我同慶；汝有歸趣，我亦有歸。
translation: If there's suffering and distress, you and I will experience it together; if there's happiness, you and I will rejoice together; and if you have a destination, I also have a return.

source_sentence: 今汝父王年登壽考，進止羸劣，世難知者所謂壽命，一旦去世我等何歸？
translation: Now, your father, the king, has reached the age limit for his life expectancy, and his progress and demeanor are so weak that it's difficult for the world to know what he calls his life span.

source_sentence: 汝今當知，有諸臣佐，共相評議，王去世後，必當與汝，受王灌頂，汝若紹位，當以國土與我分治。」』
translation: Now, you should know that there are ministers and assistants who discuss together that after the king's death, they will surely come to you and accept the king's consecration, and that if you take the throne, you will share the kingdom with me.''

source_sentence: 是時，六人童子聞輔相大堅固婆羅門如是言已，即時往詣黎努太子所，既到彼已，具如上說。
translation: After hearing this, the six boys went immediately to Prince Rinnu and arrived there as explained above.

source_sentence: 時太子言：『諸童子！
translation: The prince then said, 'Boys!

source_sentence: 若我更生之日，或有臣佐，立我嗣位與授灌頂，我於爾時不忘汝等，所有國土與汝分治，設有樂事與汝共受。』
translation: If, on the day I am reborn, some of my ministers or assistants install me as their heir and confer the consecration, I won't forget you then, and I'll divide up all the land with you and provide you with pleasant things to enjoy together.'

source_sentence: 後域主王，復經久時忽趣命終。
translation: After a long time, the king, the lord of the region, suddenly reached his end.

source_sentence: 時，諸臣佐詣太子所，到已白言：『太子！
translation: The ministers then went to the prince, and when they arrived, they said, 'Crown prince!

source_sentence: 當知，我等諸臣授汝灌頂，汝今時至宜紹王位。』
translation: 'You should know that we ministers have given you the consecration, and it's time for you to assume the throne.'

source_sentence: 時，黎努太子謂臣佐言：『汝等若能立我嗣位，其或堪任，今正是時。』
translation: Prince Rānu then addressed his ministers, saying, 'Perhaps you could appoint me to the throne, but now is the right time.'

source_sentence: 時，諸臣佐即為敷置妙師子座，太子處于座上，以妙香水灌注其頂，作如是言：『天子！
translation: The ministers then prepared a wonderful lion's seat for him, and the prince sat on it, pouring wonderful perfume over his head, and said, 'My lord!

source_sentence: 汝今時至堪嗣王位，我等諸臣奉王灌頂。』
translation: Now, when you reach the point where you're ready to inherit the throne, we ministers will consecrate the king's head.'

source_sentence: 王灌頂已，善治國政。
translation: After the king consecrated them, he ruled the country well.

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 時，黎努王受灌頂已，未久之間，五欲自娛遊戲自在。
translation: It wasn't long after he had received the consecration, but King Rānu enjoyed the five desires at his own pace.

source_sentence: 於是輔相大堅固婆羅門，往詣六人童子所，到已告言：『汝等當知，黎努太子已受灌頂，處於王位，未久之間，五欲娛樂遊戲自在。
translation: The auxiliary minister, the great solid Brahmin, went to the six boys, and when he arrived, he told them, 'You should know that Prince Rinnu has been consecrated and is on the throne, and for a short time, he'll be able to enjoy his five desires and play freely.

source_sentence: 王昔有言，與汝分治國土。
translation: The king said in the past that he would share the rule of the land with you.

source_sentence: 汝等今時宜應往彼黎努王所，作如是言：「王昔許我，畫壤分治。
translation: It's time for you to go to that king Rannu and say, "The king promised me in the past to divide and rule the land.

source_sentence: 汝王今時，能不忘不？」』
translation: Will you not forget it now, King?"

source_sentence: 時，六童子聞輔相大堅固婆羅門言已，即共往詣黎努王所，具如上說。
translation: After hearing what the auxiliary great solid Brahmin said, the six boys went together to King Rinnu and explained it exactly as above.

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 時，黎努王告六童子言：『如先所約，我記是言，我今當以此之國土等為七分與汝六人，各各分治。』
translation: King Rannu then addressed the six boys, saying, 'As promised, I've recorded this saying, 'Now I will divide this land and so forth into seven parts for each of you six to rule.'

source_sentence: 如是言已。
translation: After he said this, the six boys all said to the king.

source_sentence: 時六童子俱白王言：『若王記其言者，斯為甚善，願王速召輔相大堅固婆羅門，令彼如王教勅，申畫疆境。
translation: The six boys then all said to the king, 'This is very good, if the king has taken his advice to heart. May the king quickly summon the auxiliary minister, the great solid Brahmin, and have him define his territory according to his instructions.

source_sentence: 彼人聰利智慧明了，堪為準的。』
translation: That man is wise, intelligent, and insightful, and he's worthy of taking over.'

source_sentence: 時，黎努王乃命使人即謂之言：『汝往輔相大堅固婆羅門所，作如是言：「王今召汝，汝今宜應速至王所。」』
translation: King Rinnu then ordered his messenger to say, 'Go to the auxiliary minister, the great solid Brahmin, and say, 'The king has summoned you; now you should quickly go to the king.'

source_sentence: 使人受命，即詣輔相大堅固婆羅門所，到已如應宣示王言：『汝今宜應速至王所。』
translation: The messenger accepted the order, went to the auxiliary minister's office, the great solid Brahmin, and when he arrived, he announced to the king as he should, 'Now, you should quickly go to the king's office.'

source_sentence: 佛說大堅固婆羅門緣起經卷上
translation: Foshuo dajiangu bolomen fengyi jing shoushang
